purpose: Measure case and hotspot temperature rise at maximum load under steady-state conditions.
scope: Applies to DUTs mounted on reference PCB with specified airflow and ambient temperature.
setup: Mount DUT on reference PCB. Place in controlled ambient chamber or use local temperature monitoring. Apply maximum load current.
procedure:
1. Set ambient temperature to 25 °C.
2. Apply maximum load current.
3. Allow system to reach thermal steady state.
4. Measure case and hotspot temperatures.
5. Repeat at 50 °C ambient if required.
measurement: Record case temperature at specified reference point and any identified hotspots.
acceptancecriteria: Temperatures must remain below component-rated limits with required margin.
